label: Policy LCD_39543
description: Policy rules for LCD_39543

label: urinary_urge_incontinence_d...
description: Diagnosis of urinary urge incontinence.

label: nonobstructive_urinary_rete...
description: Diagnosis of nonobstructive urinary retention.

label: refractory_to_conventional_...
description: Patient must be refractory to conventional therapy (documented behavioral, pharmacologic, and/or surgical corrective therapy) for urinary indications.

label: surgical_candidate_status =...
description: Patient must be an appropriate surgical candidate such that implantation with anesthesia can occur.

label: test_stimulation_improvemen...
description: Minimum percentage improvement (50% or greater) required through test stimulation for urinary indications, measured through voiding diaries.

label: voiding_diary_data_recordin...
description: Patient's ability to demonstrate adequate voiding diary data recording for clinical evaluation of the implant procedure results.

label: fecal_incontinence_episodes...
description: Minimum average incontinent episodes per week (greater than 2) required for chronic fecal incontinence.

label: fecal_incontinence_duration...
description: Minimum duration of fecal incontinence (greater than 6 months).

label: post_vaginal_childbirth_inc...
description: Minimum duration of incontinence (more than 12 months) after vaginal childbirth.

label: failure_intolerance_convent...
description: Documented failure or intolerance to conventional therapy (e.g., dietary modification, bulking, and pharmacologic treatment) for fecal incontinence.

label: percutaneous_test_stimulati...
description: Minimum percentage improvement (at least 50% sustained) required for successful percutaneous test stimulation for fecal incontinence.

label: percutaneous_test_stimulati...
description: Minimum duration of sustained improvement (more than 48 hours) for percutaneous test stimulation for fecal incontinence.

label: stress_incontinence_exclusi...
description: Exclusion criteria: Patients with stress incontinence.

label: urinary_obstruction_exclusi...
description: Exclusion criteria: Patients with urinary obstruction.

label: diabetes_peripheral_nerve_i...
description: Exclusion criteria: Diabetes with peripheral nerve involvement.

label: multiple_sclerosis_exclusio...
description: Exclusion criteria: Multiple sclerosis.

label: spinal_cord_injury_exclusio...
description: Exclusion criteria: Spinal cord injury.

label: congenital_malformation_abs...
description: Field: congenital_malformation_absence_fi

label: external_anal_sphincter_def...
description: Absence of defects of the external anal sphincter over 60 degrees as a condition related to fecal incontinence.

label: pelvic_radiation_sequelae_a...
description: Absence of visible sequelae of pelvic radiation as a condition related to fecal incontinence.

label: anal_abscesses_fistulae_abs...
description: Absence of active anal abscesses and fistulae as a condition related to fecal incontinence.

label: chronic_inflammatory_bowel_...
description: Absence of chronic inflammatory bowel disease as a condition related to fecal incontinence.

label: peripheral_neuropathy_absen...
description: Field: peripheral_neuropathy_absence_fi

label: complete_spinal_cord_injury...
description: Field: complete_spinal_cord_injury_absence_fi

label: chronic_constipation_exclus...
description: Sacral nerve stimulation is considered experimental/investigational for the treatment of chronic constipation.

label: chronic_pelvic_pain_exclusi...
description: Sacral nerve stimulation is considered experimental/investigational for the treatment of chronic pelvic pain (CPP).

label: medical_record_documentatio...
description: Requirement for patient's medical record to contain documentation fully supporting medical necessity for services.
